snippet: While the new army chief of staff said he welcomed “any force” that wants to join the army, public resentment has been building over the continued existence of armed militias.
abstract: Salem al-Gnaidy, Libya's new army chief of staff, calls for militias to put themselves under command of the Libyan Army after clashes in which 31 people were killed.
lead_paragraph: While the new army chief of staff said he welcomed “any force” that wants to join the army, public resentment has been building over the continued existence of armed militias.

headline.main: Libya: Militias Are Asked to Join Army
headline.print_headline: Libya: Militias Are Asked to Join Army
